Description: A red siltware pottery jar of tall, narrow shape, modelled on the form of a situla, with a rounded base and a cylindrical neck. The top of the neck is missing. On opposite sides of the neck were two small pierced handles, near the top, but only one remains. The exterior is covered with a hard, polished red slip. On the inside clear marks of rotary production are visible.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (C), chamber 3
Curator's comments: Information regarding findspot only in Museum register.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 64, 65, 66 § 61, pl. xxxiv, 20)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.94, fig.13, p.105, p.133, p.193, pl.35)
